BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Naturally triggered wet-snow/glide-snow avalanches still possible
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is low. On extremely steep shady slopes above 2000 m, isolated small slab avalanches can still be triggered in the old snow, esp. with large additional loading in transitions from shallow to deep snow, e.g. at entries into gullies and bowls. At intermediate altitudes Ã¶on extremely steep slopes in all aspects, naturally triggered wet-snow/glide-snow avalanches are possible which can reach medium size. Beware potential starting zones.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack base is stable by and large, but moist down to the ground, which means it can glide over smooth ground. On high-altitude north-facing slopes there are older snowdrift accumulations, mostly well bonded. Reserves of cold are disappearing also on shady slopes. On southfacing slopes the snow is already m,oist and soft up to summit levels, at lower altitudes what little snow there is, is wet.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: On Saturday in the Northern Alps, sunshine and dry weather all day long. South of the Main Alpine Ridge, low lying cloud will persist, high peaks in fog, occasional minor rainfall, snowfall above 1400 m, moderate southerly winds, brisk in exposed terrain. At 2000 m: +1 degree.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: On Sunday, mostly sunny from the start accompanied by often storm-strength southerly winds. At 2000 m: 0 degrees. Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Low avalanche danger, no marked problem
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is low. Due to rain impact and mild temperatures, the focus of danger zones lies on wet-snow and glide-snow avalanches. Very isolated wet slides possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack base is stable by and large, but moist down to the ground, which means it can glide over smooth ground. Atop of it since some fresh snow which is now soft and sticky. On shady slopes there are hardly any remaining reserves of cold in the snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: On Saturday in the Northern Alps, sunshine and dry weather all day long. South of the Main Alpine Ridge, low lying cloud will persist, high peaks in fog, occasional minor rainfall, snowfall above 1400 m, moderate southerly winds, brisk in exposed terrain. At 2000 m: +1 degree.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: On Sunday, mostly sunny from the start accompanied by often storm-strength southerly winds. At 2000 m: 0 degrees. Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly.
